semantic_title: COVID-19 Signs and Symptoms Without Definitive Diagnosis
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > g. Coronavirus infections > 1) COVID-19 infection > (g) Signs and symptoms without definitive diagnosis of COVID-19

content.full_text: For patients presenting with any signs/symptoms associated with COVID-19 (such as fever, etc.) but a definitive diagnosis has not been established, assign the appropriate code(s) for each of the presenting signs and symptoms such as: • R05.1, Acute cough, or R05.9, Cough, unspecified • R06.02 Shortness of breath • R50.9 Fever, unspecified. If a patient with signs/symptoms associated with COVID-19 also has an actual or suspected contact with or exposure to COVID-19, assign Z20.822, Contact with and (suspected) exposure to COVID-19, as an additional code. (Evidence: pg no: 30, L94-L102)
